result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Sentencing hearing on January 26, 2023 at 01:15 pm.
Sentencing hearing on November 21, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

3:27 PM  Attorney Robert Thorson appeared via video for DE. DA Ellen Anderson appeared in person.  All cases 21TR455, 20CF69, 20CF101, 21CF171, 21CF182, 21CF227, 21TR454, 20CF13, and 21CF171 heard at the same time.     Hearing is to address Attorney Thorson request for a continuance of the sentencing hearing scheduled for Friday, 10/28/22.   State objected to adjournment. State attempted to contact victim.    Attorney Thorson argument.  .  State's argument.  Attorney Thorson's response.   Court adjourned the sentencings from 10/28/22 and revoked the bonds.  DE has until 3:00 PM on 10/28/22 to report to the Rusk County Jail.    If DE does not report to the Rusk County Jail a BW will be issued with body only.   All cases set for SEH as a #1 on 1/26/23 at 1:15 to 2:00 PM.  Scheduled as a number #2 on 11/21/22 at 1:15 PM. until 2:30 PM.  DE will contact DE and advise him he has to report.   Adj. 4:00 PM.

Sentencing hearing on October 28, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

9:03 AM Defendant Nicolas A Wehrmeister appeared by phone.  Attorney Robert Allen Thorson appeared by video for Nicolas A Wehrmeister.  Attorney Ellen Anderson appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Heard along with 20CF69, 20CF101, 21CF171, 21CF182, 21CF227, 21TR454, 21TR455, 22CF13.  Time set for Plea/Sentencing. DOC had written a letter requesting additional time to complete the PSI, Agent reports that she will have the PSI filed by June 17.  Set for Plea/Sentencing September 6, 2022 @ 9:00AM.

1:29 PM Defendant Nicolas A Wehrmeister in court.  Attorney Robert Allen Thorson in court for Nicolas A Wehrmeister.  Attorney Emily Nelson in court for State of Wisconsin. 11:06 AM Defendant Nicolas A Wehrmeister in court with attorney Robert Allen Thorson.  Annette M Barna appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Heard along with 20CF69, 20CF101, 21CF171, 21CF182,21CF227, 21TR454, 21TR455, 22CF13.  State puts on the record that DE would like the opportunity to complete the IDIP program in 21CF227 so this case will need to be sentenced at another date. 

Court instructs on plea questionnaire/waiver of rights.  DE advised of Constitutional Rights, Factual basis/ PC found, plea freely, knowingly, voluntarily made, court accepts plea of NC, finds DE guilty.  

20CF69-DE will enter a plea to Ct's 2 and 3.  Ct's 1-4 will be DRI.  

20CF101-DE will enter a plea to amended Ct 1.  Ct 2 will be DRI

21CF171- DE will enter a plea of Ct 3. Ct's 1, 2 will be DRI.

21CF182- Case will be DRI

21CF227-Case will be sentenced at another date, DE will enter into the IDIP program. Case will be held open. 

21TR454, 21TR455 will be DRI

22CF13-Case will be DRI.

Parties will recommend a PSI be prepared.  Sentencing set for June 13, 2022 @ 1:30PM.  PSI to be filed by May 23, 2022.
Sentencing hearing on June 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Case settlement

ADDRESS INFO for Nicolas A Wehrmeister
Current: 705 E 4th St S Apt 5, Ladysmith, WI 54848 United States  (Effective: 02-15-2022)
Prior: 217 W. 3rd Street N, Ladysmith, WI 54848
Plea/sentencing hearing on February 15, 2022 at 11:00 am.

03:55 PM Defendant Nicolas A Wehrmeister in court.  Attorney Rober Thorson appeared with the DE. Attorney Annette M Barna appeared by video means for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin.  22CF13 set for INIT.    20CF69, 20CF101, 21CF171, 21CF182, 21CF227, 21TR454, and 21TR455 all set for RH.    20CF69 and 20CF101 set for JT on 2/17 and 2/18.  Attorney Thorson informed the Court that the DE would like to accept the plea offer as presented by the State.    Court removed JT from the court calendar and Clerk can cancel jurors.    Plea set for 2/15/22 at 11:00 AM in all cases.     Adj. 4:00 PM.

DE must reside with his father (Paul Wehrmeister) at: 705 E 4th St S. Apt 5, Ladysmith, WI 54848.    DE must be in inpatient treatment within 30 days.  If not in treatment or leaves treatment his bond will revert to cash.  DE is to notify the State of enrollment date.    Defendant is not to consume or possess alcohol.  Do not enter premises where alcohol is primary business, any bars taverns or liquor stores or any other establishment where the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.  No possession/consumption or use of illegal or illicit drugs, or any substance intended to use to alter mental state or mood.  Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  No possession of medications not prescribed to you by a physician.  No contact with CW.   Any cash bond posted for Defendant shall be used for fines, costs and restitution pursuant to WI STAT 969.13(5)
21GF245 into 22CF13
Embrace paperwork completed by CW
